title: Is it just me or is Darius overbearingly strong?
body:
Darius has the HIGHEST PICK RATE top lane by far AND the
HIGHEST BAN RATE in top lane by far. He cannot be 1v1ed by a vast majority of top laners unless the Darius seriously misplays. What angers me is that he INVALIDATES bruisers/Juggernauts/tanks with low mobility because of his 2 slows and stun which make it very hard to escape him and turn simple trades into extended fights where he will very likely kill you. If he's taking Conqueror or Phase rush you're fucked.

The reason people are so quick to defend him is that if you aren't banning Darius you're likely abusing him for elo and wouldn't want your crutch to get nerfed.

replies.body:
As an L7 Darius player, perhaps I can shed some light on the subject.

Yes, Darius has a strong early game. He is intended to, as are many of his compatriots in the Juggernaut Sub-class. The way to beat him to pick characters that can dart around him, run circles around him. People that can get in, do damage, and get out quickly before Darius can really retaliate all that well.

Examples: {{champion:92}} , {{champion:23}} and many more.

Others that can beat him are ranged top-laners, such as: {{champion:133}} , {{champion:150}} and of course, the one and only {{champion:17}} .
These champs can give Darius (and really any other immoblie melee champ) a severe thrashing, as they can use their range to kite him all day long.

By denying him the ability to snowball via his strong early-game, you GREATLY reduce the threat a Darius can pose. Now that doesn't mean you can get cocky, because any Darius player worth their salt CAN turn things around if given the chance.
50-70% pick ban in pro play makes me want to say that he is lul
He's not really. You just need to be careful around him.
